headline: Carolina Pulled Pork Sandwiches
description: With the help of your trusty slow cooker, you can enjoy tangy Carolina-style pulled pork sandwiches with just 30 minutes of hands-on time.
name: Carolina Pulled Pork Sandwiches
recipeIngredient: 8 hamburger buns or bakery rolls, split

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the Carolina Vinegar Sauce: Vigorously whisk together vinegar, ketchup, brown sugar, Worcestershire, crushed red pepper, and mustard in a medium bowl until sugar dissolves. Measure 1/2 cup sauce into a small bowl; reserve for slow cooker. Cover remaining sauce (about 2 cups) in medium bowl; set aside for serving.

Prepare the Pulled Pork: Pat pork dry with paper towels. Stir together pimenton, brown sugar, salt, mustard, onion powder, celery salt, garlic salt, and pepper in a small bowl; sprinkle all over pork. Heat oil in a large cast-iron skillet or heavy-bottomed pan over high until hot but not smoking. Add pork; cook, turning occasionally, until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes. Transfer pork to a 5- to 6-quart slow cooker. Add beer to skillet; reduce heat to medium, and cook 30 seconds, stirring to scrape up any browned bits from skillet bottom.

Cook Pulled Pork: Pour beer mixture and reserved 1/2 cup sauce over pork in slow cooker. Cover and cook until pork easily pulls away from bone using a fork, 5 to 6 hours on HIGH or 8 to 10 hours on LOW. Remove pork from slow cooker, and transfer to a large heatproof bowl; let stand 15 minutes. Remove and discard bone. Shred meat using 2 forks. Add 1 cup of the reserved sauce from medium bowl to meat, and toss to coat. Serve pork on buns with remaining sauce on the side.

review.reviewBody: This recipe makes the most authentic tasting Carolina style pulled pork. I made it for a neighborhood potluck and even my picky foodie neighbors loved it.

mainEntity.name: Can I skip the ketchup in the barbecue sauce?

acceptedAnswer.text: Depending on where you hail from, you may or may not like to include ketchup in your barbecue sauce. Feel free to leave it out if that's your preference, and season the sauce to balance the flavors.

mainEntity.name: Is it better to cook pulled pork on HIGH or LOW in the slow cooker?

acceptedAnswer.text: Whether you choose to cook on HIGH for 5 to 6 hours or LOW for 8 to 10, the pork will be tender and juicy using a slow cooker.

mainEntity.name: Do I need bone-in pork shoulder for pulled pork?

acceptedAnswer.text: We call for bone-in pork shoulder here—the bone deepens the flavor of the meat and cooking liquid and helps the meat stay moist. You can also use pork butt, which has a higher fat content.
